intro: Sphaeralcea hainesii, commonly known as Haines' globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its globular, yellow-orange flower heads that resemble small globes, which are composed of numerous tiny, petal-less flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy, glandular leaves that help reduce water loss and reflect sunlight. Sphaeralcea hainesii is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits.
